intro: Linaria semialata, commonly known as the lesser toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow flowers with two lobes, resembling a small toad's mouth, which gives it its common name. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Linaria semialata is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
